title: Coping up with college stress
author: author A
content:
> Stress is a mental situation in which a person feels ***overwhelmed*** and is unable to work productively. It is one of the most common ***psychological problem*** faced by humans these days

# How it happens

There can be many reasons why college students might get stressed. It might be that they are unable to finish their project. Or maybe they are not able to get good scores in exams. Some might be stressed due to competition for internships and jobs. There might also be many personal reasons which act as precursors for stress.

# Coping up with stress

There are some well tested ways to cope up with stress, they are: -

## Physical workout

Although not very obvious, but few minutes of exercise can help to reduce stress levels significantly.

## Keeping a hobby

A hobby such as dancing, reading, debating etc. can help a person to not lose the purpose of life and it helps keep him or her motivated.

# What to do if my friend/ family member is stressed?

In such a case, you should try to make them talk out their problems, many times this itself can heal the other person. You can give your own example to make them realize that such a situation is common and it will pass on. You should try to motivate them but at the same time also provide them some personal time in which they can reflect upon themselves.

title: How to expand your network
author: author B
content:
# Why to expand network

A large network in college life is a must. It helps in following manner
* Making new friends
* Getting help in difficult times
* Getting inspiration from seniors
* and a lot more! (give more ideas in discussions)

# How to

Coming to the main question, expanding a network is an art. It requires good communication skills and presence of mind. Some useful steps you can follow are
* Talk to seniors and your teachers
* Help your friends in need
* Become active on social media (but be careful to not get distracted! Use social media like linkedin or `this app`.

# Further points
Always be careful that not all people are helpful and supportive. If you feel uncomfortable about someone then do not fear in breaking bond with that person even if your network gets harmed.

title: Approaches to learn coding
author: author C
content:
# Why coding is important

Coding has, in recent times, become an essential skill which everyone should know. It gives the capability to utilize the speed and accuracy of computers. It can benefit in automating mundane tasks. E.g., if you get a homework to compute 5 complex integrals which are similar, like 

 $ \int_0^{\infty} \left( \frac{1}{t^4} \right) dt $ 

 or maybe you have to draw graph of a function like 

 $ f(x) = \begin{cases} x^2 \text{, } x \le 4 \\ 2x-x^3 \text{, } 2 \le x \le 5 \\ 0 \text{, } x \gt 5 \end{cases} $ 

 you could just write a program and automate your task! 

 > For engineers, coding is a must since it is one of those technical skills which can help on a long run.

# Ways to learn coding

There can be different ways to learn coding, they depend upon the final place one wants to reach.
* For automating day to day tasks: In such a case, python is the best language to begin with. It has an easy to read syntax and many pre-built libraries. A hello world program in python is like this

```py
print("Hello World")
```
* For making performant/ business quality programs: In such a case, one of the best approach is to start learning with C and C++ and then move on to higher level languages. A hello world program in C would be like
```c
#include<stdio.h>

int main() {
	return 0;
}
```

# Conclusion

Therefore, we finally conclude that the perfect way to learn coding is different for different people and you should take the pathway that you like the most.

title: How to get good CGPA
author: Nikhil
content:
# Go Through Your Syllabus Properly

Before diving into your studies, it's crucial to have a clear understanding of your syllabus. Knowing what topics and subjects you need to cover will allow you to create a ***structured study plan***. Carefully review your course outline to ensure you don't miss any important areas.

# Refer to Previous Year Question Papers for Practice

*Practice makes perfect*, and one of the best ways to prepare for exams is by solving previous year's question papers. These papers provide insights into the exam pattern, question types, and the level of difficulty you can expect. Use them to gauge your knowledge and ***identify areas that need improvement***.

# Make Proper Notes

Effective note-taking is a skill that can significantly boost your understanding of complex subjects. Create ***concise, organized notes*** for theoretical subjects. For subjects like mathematics, in addition to notes, practice solving a variety of problems to gain a deeper understanding of the concepts.

# Analyze Properly for Weightage

Not all topics carry the same weightage in exams. Some subjects may have more marks allocated to specific chapters or units. Analyze past exam patterns or consult your teachers to identify which topics hold the most weight. Allocate more of your study time to these high-value areas.

# Create and Follow a Timetable

A well-structured timetable is your roadmap to success. Create a daily or weekly schedule that allocates specific time slots for each subject and activity. Ensure you have a ***balanced routine*** that includes study, breaks, and relaxation. Display your timetable in your study area as a constant reminder.

# Avoid Procrastination

***Procrastination is the enemy of productivity***. Train yourself to stay focused and disciplined. Set ***small, achievable goals*** for each study session, and reward yourself when you accomplish them. Identify your most productive times of the day and prioritize challenging subjects during those periods.

# Seek Help When Needed

Don't hesitate to seek help from your teachers or peers when you encounter difficulties. If you're unable to solve certain questions or concepts remain unclear, approach your teachers for clarification. They are there to support your learning journey.

>Getting a good CGPA requires ***dedication***, ***discipline***, and ***effective study techniques***. By understanding your syllabus, practicing with previous year's question papers, making organized notes, prioritizing high-weightage topics, adhering to a well-structured timetable, avoiding procrastination, and seeking assistance when needed, you can significantly improve your academic performance. Remember that ***consistency and perseverance*** are key to achieving your goal of a high CGPA.
